results.title: In-Live Class
results.overview: Since the pandemic started in 2019, lots of school activities were switched from in-person class to online remote class setting. It's a natural step with its own challenge, a lack of discipline (this, and constant distraction from TV, phones, doing errands). Student find it difficult to be punctual and attend class regularly with little to no supervision from teachers and parental figures.

article.content: Since the pandemic started in 2019, lots of school activities were switched from in-person class to online remote class setting. It's a natural step with its own challenge, a lack of discipline (this, and constant distraction from TV, phones, doing errands). Student find it difficult to be punctual and attend class regularly with little to no supervision from teachers and parental figures.
As the oldest brother of two little brothers attending these online remote class, I decided to look into it and try some design exploration.

article.label: Design process used in this case study

article.content: I started by interviewing few students who were transitioning from in-person class to online remote class setting, two of which were my own little brothers. The interview revolves around day to day activities during class, difference between in-person and remote, and any friction of remote class they've been experiencing.
These are key takeaways of the interviews.

list.content: They could get bored very easily, thus affecting concentration
They felt distant with their peers
They waited more for teachers to check their assignments
They used to be looking forward to play some games after school during their commute back home

article.content: While number 1 to 3 require interpersonal fix and might be different from person to person, number 4 were quite interesting. Apparently, remote class eliminates the need for commute. Many of the students said the could finish a game quickly because of this. They could quickly get bored because they have finished all their games.
With these key takeaways in mind, I move on with this idea :
How might we combine school and game elements to increase their incentive to attend class?
After defining the HMW statement, I started to explore how the live class experience would look like using paper sketch.
Using the paper sketch, I started working on the hi-fi wireframe. I gather visual references from dribbbles and pinterest. Then, I design the wireframe using Adobe XD.

The idea of badges is the same as game points and the concept of achievements. Finishing more class means more points. More points means you get more exclusive badges you can show to your peers. The same as completing an achievement in a game.

Like badges, leaderboard also took a common game element of rankings. Students attending class can see the badges and points of their peers. With leaderboard, I hope to get students more competitive with each other, thus creating incentive to finish more classes.
In this project, I learned about how to write a case study using HMW Statement. I also learned of many ways of displaying in-live class experience.
For now, the project only explores the design of in-live class experience. I would like to explore more for the dashboard and what kind of data student needs to be displayed there.

results.title: Bimata's Storywork
results.overview: The Storywork is a project from my high school times where I publish my fictions. It can be short story, flash fiction, song lyric, anything that I wrote or collaborated.

article.content: The Storywork is a project from my high school times where I publish my fictions. It can be short story, flash fiction, song lyric, anything that I wrote or collaborated. As a high school student with limited technical knowledge, I could only afford to use blogspot, a free blogging platform.
After I graduated from college, things become different. I have more technical knowledge than before. Then I started to have this need to always try to create something, to always learning.
"Why don't I started develop a website for the Storywork?"
It makes sense. I can use this as my portfolio and I also wanted learn more about developing from WordPress, one of the best blogging platform that's also a CMS. So, for me it's a big win.

I want the new website to have a distraction-free environment, to have a better reading experience. I look for inspirations and found this clean looking template. I decided to use this template as the basis of my custom WordPress template and customize it more for anything I need.
Here's the end result of the project:
The home page shows the most recent stories I publish. Refresh this page for keep you posted.
Every story falls in post type content. It has a comment section for interaction. Readers can also share my stories using social media of their choice.
Aside from short story and flash fiction, the post category can also serves as series chapter page should I publish story series in the future.
For non-story type of content. Like for example, an about page.
I was happy to learn a lot about WordPress in this project. Adding some kind of visual illustration for each story will be my next exploration.

results.title: Regal Lite Ver.
results.overview: Since 1952, Regal has been the number one brand of Marie Biscuits in Indonesia. In 2014 & 2015, Regal Marie Biscuits achieved the “Top Brand” in the Marie Biscuit category in Indonesia.

article.content: Since 1952, Regal has been the number one brand of Marie Biscuits in Indonesia. In 2014 & 2015, Regal Marie Biscuits achieved the “Top Brand” in the Marie Biscuit category in Indonesia. Beyond the domestic market, Marie Regal is also distributed internationally and it is also successful in winning several awards and trophies at several food expos and trade shows in the Netherlands, Japan, Germany, Bulgaria, Poland, Italy, Yugoslavia, Thailand, France and the United States.

Their main website took the form of a kingdom with various objects like royal castle, airport, and buildings that users can interact. With such complex form, this main version is best viewed from desktop and not so much on mobile. Hence the need of a lite version.
My role was to wrote the front-end code for this project. Here’s the result:
The front page that shows the current products of Regal.
Here, the biscuit products are explained with more detail.
This page shows the main ingredients of Regal biscuits.
This page shows the process of Regal biscuits.
Regal can share their news here.
This page shows Regal’s address from around the world.
If you want to get in touch with Regal, use this page.
